medium: Ink, colors, and gold on paper
title: Death of Buddha (parinirvana)
marks: Signature and Marks LRC, in gold: {Gyo-undo- Cho-ko kinga}
text: Like its monumental companion, this smaller example of a nirvana painting illustrates the Buddha’s death in traditional fashion. The square “Kunju” relief seal dates this painting to a time before Itchō was exiled to a small island in Izu province in 1699.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by the Clark Family in honor of Dr A. Jess Shenson
